page.title: 10HOUSING IN MID DEVON
page.content: Many of the houses are the characteristic 'Devon long house' - two storeys but long and low with a central front porch entrance and painted white. They are normally built of cob and stone and the original thatched roof has been replaced by slates. Many are over 400 years old. As the area is roughly 600/700 feet above sea level most houses have been built either end on to or backing on to the prevailing west wind with the main rooms on the sheltered side. Most of the farms are away from the road at the end of a long lane or drive and often cannot be seen by the passerby. The upkeep and improving of property are major concerns and many householders do much of their own maintenance. There are about 20 farms with their attendant buildings.
